info.title: Portcast API (1.1.0) - Bill of Lading Tracking
info.description:
**This documentation is for the latest version of the Portcast Bill of Lading Tracking API.**

There are two variables used in this documentation:
1. `api-url`: the url to use for accessing the API. The official url is `https://api.portcast.io`
2. `x-api-key`: the access token to send along with every request to the API. This key will be provided to each organisation upon API access activation

The general workflow is as below:

1. Create the bill of lading bookmark if it does not exist already (`POST {{api-url}}/api/v1/eta/bill-of-lading-bookmarks`).
2. A bookmark must contain `carrier_no`, `bl_no` and `cntr_no` information. This will return the bill of lading bookmark information created. Record the `id` field from the response.
3. Wait for predictions to be generated. This could take up to 5 mins.
5. Query for the tracking results based on the `id` recorded earlier (`GET {{api-url}}/api/v1/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks/<id>`)

tags.name: Tracking
tags.description: Get tracking results for the vessel bookmarks

post.description:
Please send the bill of lading or booking number with the following fields:
```
{
    "carrier_no": <string, required, scac code of carrier, will use first 4 characters of bl_no as carrier_no if left empty>,
    "bl_no": <string, required, ocean carrier bill of lading number>,
    "dock_type": <string, required, type of doc_no. Accept value: BK (booking) , BL (Bill of Lading)>
}
```

get.summary: Get a list of bookmarked bill of ladings
get.description:
This api returns 5 records at a time, please use the value of the `_ended_at` field in the response as the `_start_after` value in a subsequent request to get the next 5 records.

You could filter based the parameters listed.

parameters.name: _start_after
parameters.description: start query from after this voyage bookmark id

parameters.name: _ascending
parameters.description: if set to true, sort results based on creation time in ascending order. false by default

parameters.name: bl_no
parameters.description: filter on the bill of lading number

post.summary: Create a new bill of lading bookmark
post.description:
Please send the bill of lading with the following fields:
```
{
    "carrier_no": <string, required, scac code of carrier, will use first 4 characters of bl_no as carrier_no if left empty>,
    "bl_no": <string, required, ocean carrier bill of lading number>,
    "cntr_no": <string, required, the container number you want to track from the bill of lading>
}
```

get.summary: Get a particular bill of lading bookmark by ID

delete.summary: Delete a particular bill of lading bookmark by ID

get.summary: Get a list of bill of lading bookmark tracking results based on filters
get.description:
This api returns 5 records at a time, please use the value of the `_ended_at` field in the response as the `_start_after` value in a subsequent request to get the next 5 records.

You could filter based the following parameters listed.

parameters.name: _start_after
parameters.description: start query from after this voyage bookmark id

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: get last prediction result made before this timestamp, must be in ISO8601 format with timezone, defaults to now

parameters.name: carrier_no
parameters.description: filter on the carrier scac code

parameters.name: bl_no
parameters.description: filter on the imo number of the vessel

parameters.name: cntr_no
parameters.description: filter on the target port by port code

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: filter on the target port eta

get.summary: Get bill of lading bookmark tracking results for a particular bill of lading bookmark by ID
get.description:
This will return the bill of lading bookmark, augmented bill of lading, container information and container events, sailing information, vessel ais information, vessel voyage information.

Please note that the prediction engine runs two times a day at the moment. So the prediction results would only be updated two times a day.

Sample response as below:
